header.relationships: Close family, partners, very close friends
header.topics: Drama, Actors and Films, Presents, Clothes, Sherlock, Generational Differences, Christmas
header.activity: Mother and Daughter discuss popular culture
header.conv_type: discussing, explaining, inquiring, making arrangements, telling jokes

body.u: yeah so drama lesson today working on the monologues
so I'm doing the piece from Little Voice
it was good yeah she just she was getting all of us to show like a little segment of it we had to learn it and do it
and if I'd known I probably would have learned the whole monologue beforehand but I hadn't I hadn't realised she was going to ask us to perform it off script so
just did a little bit like
the first I don't know third of it
and erm yeah cos I've got screaming in mine I have to scream
she was like do you want to go into the corridor I was like yes I will go into the corridor so I don't disrupt everyone with my screaming every five minutes
erm so I did but then you awkwardly had people walking through and erm ah like a bit part of the my thing is that I'm holding this like half of a broken record
which I can actually have when I'm performing it I can buy a load of records break them and put them on the floor
to make the scene which is cool
erm but I ha so every time someone like walked through I had my hand like cclenched as if I was holding this record
and it would just be there and they'd walk past and I I'd have stopped and I still have my hand in that position
it must have looked so strange
but I think it I think it went really well like she
I was the last one who had time to do it in the lesson I think a couple of people have to do it next time cos they didn't have time today
but erm she erm yeah it was her it was who's one of the drama teachers and who's a
and erm they were they gave us feedback afterwards and like I think I think they quite liked mine although she was saying you still need to strengthen your northern accent a bit
I actually forgot to do it on the first line
I got the first line in and I was like yeah I'm meant to be doing a northern accent switch into that quickly
oh it's erm and now you will listen one time one not in a northern accent but anyway
but yeah and then I scream
which is fun er yeah she thought I had a reasonably original take on it and banned me from watching the movie cos she said that would ruin it
and I'd end up doing it like the movie
she gave me like a few pointers of things I needed to do like I do some muttering
and it needs to be muttering but muttering so that it's distinct and audible
which yeah is ha it's like whispering whispering is so hard to act and it's the same with muttering
cos you you still they still need to be able to hear it
it's crazy but erm and also er her and gave me some plays to read that are about the northern working class at that time
cos I was saying to her that I'd read up about the play online but there wasn't much about it cos I we have to write this like piece about it
and talk about like social historical
and political context I was like well there there isn't any? and she was like oh yeah there's a bit but you can like in saying you can talk about the whole working class
working men's club and mm mm
and yeah wor that's exactly like a massive part of it
and erm and you can compare her to other characters er like and the stereotypes of the northern woman that are in these other plays
or that aren't in these other plays
and yeah so that that'll be interesting
oh that'll be good to do what were the other? some of the other plays?
oh I got road which is by the same author Jim Cartwright
oh I've not heard of that
yeah cos that's the thing you know? the whole erm fabric of their sort of society if you like you know? northern towns was tied up in working men's clubs because you know that's where they all went

erm you know? even like where dad is from in originally heck of a lot of working men's clubs round there because it was ken what do they call it? I've forgot what they call it chem city or something because of all the different chemical plants there and so
you can imagine it was a very you know working class area and a heck of a lot of working class clubs and everything and Wales was very much like that all the miners you know?
and erm that was sort of where their the epicentre if you like of their social life was really
yeah and like it plays a big part in er The Rise and Fall of Little Voice cos erm
this tow this er talent scout who's not actually all that much but he discovers her and he makes her sing at these working men's clubs
